articles.author: Clare Baldwin, Helen Reid
articles.description: Waste from at least 19 international brands including Adidas and Walmart is being used to fuel kilns in brick factories in Cambodia, and some workers were falling ill, according to a report by a local rights group released on Monday.
articles.title: Waste from Adidas, Walmart, other brands fuelling Cambodia brick kilns - report

articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto, Kentaro Sugiyama
articles.description: Japan's big employers are set to follow this year's bumper pay hikes with another round in 2024, which are expected to help lift household spending and give the central bank the conditions it needs to finally roll back massive monetary stimulus.
articles.title: Japan's back-to-back wage bonanza would open door for BOJ exit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's Bayer (BAYGn.DE) has aborted a large late-stage trial testing a new anti-clotting drug for lack of efficacy, dealing a fresh blow to the embattled drugmaker and throwing its most promising medium-term development project in doubt.
articles.title: Bayer stops blood thinner drug trial for lack of effect in major setback

articles.author: Rajesh Singh
articles.description: Andrew Watterson knows the cost of flight disruptions.
articles.title: Southwest, other US airlines face holiday travel test after 2022 blizzard

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Foxtron Vehicle Technologies (2258.TW), a unit of iPhone supplier Foxconn (2317.TW), fell as much as 9% in their market debut on Monday, hurt concerns over potential headwinds in the highly competitive electric vehicle market.
articles.title: Shares of Foxconn's EV unit slide 9% in market debut

articles.author: Rachel Savage, Karin Strohecker
articles.description: Zambia suffered a major setback in its debt restructuring efforts, after the government said on Monday a revised deal to rework $3 billion of Eurobonds could not be implemented at this time due to objections from official creditors, including China.
articles.title: Zambia dealt major setback as official creditors object to bond deal

articles.author: Curtis Williams
articles.description: Venezuela is close to approving a license for Shell (SHEL.L) and the National Gas Company of Trinidad and Tobago to develop a promising offshore natural gas field and export its production to the Caribbean country, two people close to the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Venezuela close to approving offshore gas license with Trinidad, Shell

articles.author: Clauda Tanios, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli tanks were positioned around a hospital complex in north Gaza where 12 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded, the enclave's health ministry said on Monday as fighting raged on amid indications of an impending pause in hostilities.
articles.title: Israeli tanks reported near hospital in embattled north Gaza

articles.author: Nicolás Misculin, Walter Bianchi
articles.description: Argentina was on tenterhooks on Sunday as voting ended in a tight presidential runoff, with two starkly different visions for the country's future on offer and an electorate simmering with anger at triple-digit inflation and rising poverty.
articles.title: Argentina voting ends in nail-biter election with libertarian slight favorite

articles.author: Saeed Azhar, Isla Binnie, Tatiana Bautzer
articles.description: Citigroup (C.N) employees expect the bank to announce layoffs and senior management changes on Monday as part of its biggest reorganization in decades, according to five sources with knowledge of the matter.
articles.title: Citigroup employees brace for layoffs, management overhaul -sources
